business.headline: Sensex, Nifty closing: Top stocks that gained and lost on BSE, NSEIT and auto sector stocks dragged the market down. The fall in IT and auto stocks is linked to concerns over US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to come into effect on April 2.

Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: Here's how much central government employees will earn nowWith the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

How India saw a billionaire boom in just 10 yearsIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start on March 6 as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.
Wall Street drifts as auto tariffs hurt GM, help Tesla and othersDonald Trump's auto tariffs impacted Wall Street on Thursday morning, with autogiant General Motors falling by 6.8%.

Trump's 25% auto tariff: Which Indian companies will pay the priceUS President Donald Trump's 25% tariff on car imports will affect a few Indian companies, including Tata Motors, Eicher Motors, and Samvardhana Motherson. These firms ship components to the US and Europe's markets.

Sensex, Nifty close higher: Top gainers and losers, tariff impact and key driversStock market today: Some of the top gainers during today's session were Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd Bank, NTPC, L&T, Ultratech Cement, Hero MotoCorp, Adani Enterprises and BPCL. On the other hand, some of the top losers were Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCLTech.

Sensex ends 318 points higher, Nifty just below 23,600; Tata Motors down 5%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 317.93 points higher at 77,606.43, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 105.10 points to settle at 23,591.95.

Noida, Greater Noida flat registration fees may rise 20-30%According to a draft notification, circle rates in Noida could see a 20% hike, while in Greater Noida, the increase may go up to 30%. The move is expected to make property transactions more expensive in the region.

India may receive reprieve from proposed US tariffs: SourcesIndia may escape the proposed US tariffs and avoid being grouped with nations like China, Mexico, and Canada, according to government sources. Trade talks between the two countries are progressing smoothly, with no signs of a deadlock as the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs approaches.

RBI may double foreign individual investor limit to 10% in listed firms: ReportForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), pressured by poor earnings, high valuations and prospects of U.S. tariffs, have pulled more than $28 billion out of Indian stocks since September's record high in the benchmark NSE Nifty 50.

Elon Musk leads Hurun Global Rich List despite $100 billion drop in net worthElon Musk has reretained his position as the wealthiest person in the world for the fourth time in five years, becoming the first individual to surpass the $400 billion threshold, noted the Hurun Research report.

US tariff reprieve for India, may not be treated like China, Canada, Mexico: SourcesTrade talks between the two nations are progressing smoothly, with no deadlock expected before the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs.

Infosys terminates more trainees from Mysuru campus, but offers…: ReportInfosys has terminated more trainees from its Myrusu campus. The IT giant had terminated hundreds of trainees from the same campus just two months ago.

Tata Motors shares slump as US slaps 25% duty on car importsTata Motors stock price: Tata Motors shares slumped 6% in early trade and were trading 5.26% lower at Rs 670.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9.55 am.

Sensex, Nifty gain after opening lower in volatile trade; Wipro rises nearly 2%Stock market opening: While the Sensex opened 100 points lower, it was trading 64.27 points higher at 77,552.77 at around 9.26 am. The Nifty50 was trading 16.75 points higher at 23,503.60.

Top stocks to watch today: Tata Motors, Wipro, JB Chemicals, Infosys, Vedanta, UPLWhile positive cues are likely to support the two leading indices on Dalal Street, US tariff uncertainty looms large. Here are some of the key stocks that will be in focus today.

Stock market on March 27: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty today?Stock market prediction: Nifty and Sensex have gained nearly 2% in the past five sessions, but investors will now be watching to see if the market can recover from Wednesday's drop.

How can India cement its position in the global value chain?With global value chains (GVCs) driving over 70% of international trade, India's growth story hinges on its ability to integrate into and scale within these networks.

Tesla to enter Saudi Arabia as Elon Musk mends rift with kingdomAmerican EV giant Tesla announced its entry into the Saudi Arabian market after company CEO Elon Musk's relations with the Kingdom improved in recent months.

UPI outage hits several users across India, NPCI says issue resolvedThe National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) acknowledged the issue, stating that it was caused by intermittent technical difficulties, resulting in partial transaction failures.
Wall Street is drifting again after getting whipsawed for weeksThe New York Stock Exchange saw a steady opening on Wednesday with marginal drops for S&P 500 and the Nasdaq composite.

Cancer, diabetes drugs under government price control to get costlier: SourcesGovernment-controlled medicines, including that of cancer, diabetes, heart-related concerns and other antibiotics, are set to become more expensive by 1.7 per cent, government sources told India Today TV's sister publication, Business Today.

Stock market closing: Top gainers and losers on Sensex, NiftyBenchmark indices snapped their seven-day winning streak, as investors turned cautious ahead of the monthly expiry. The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 728.69 points to close at 77,288.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 181.80 points, ending the session at 23,486.85.

India may lower duties on Harley-Davidson bikes, bourbon whiskey: SourcesIndia may further reduce import duties on Harley-Davidson motorcycles, US wines, and bourbon whiskey as part of ongoing India-US trade talks, according to sources.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points, Nifty settles below 23,500; IndusInd Bank up 3%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 728.69 points lower to 77,288.50,  while the NSE Nifty50 declined 181.80 points to settle at 23,486.85.

entertainment.headline: Jewel Thief stars Jaideep Ahlawat, Nikita Dutta on a heist to win hearts. WatchJaideep Ahlawat and his Jewel Thief co-star Nikita Dutta won hearts with their adorable video on the song 'Price Tag'. Their upcoming film is slated to release on Netflix on April 25.

Neha Kakkar's Melbourne event organisers deny claim of mismanagement: We're in debtSinger Neha Kakkar's Melbourne concert organisers have denied her claims of mismanagement and said that in fact after the event, they are the ones in debt.

Mohanlal's Empuraan to have 17 cuts after row over riot depiction: SourcePrithviraj Sukumaran's directorial, Empuraan, will have 17 cuts in the film after protests erupted online over the film's indirect depiction of the Gujarat riots. It is reported that the edited version will be screened from April 2.

Sonu Nigam visits LK Advani and his daughter, calls them his 'extended family'Singer Sonu Nigam recently visited the residence of veteran BJP leader LK Advani in New Delhi. The artiste shared a post highlighting the same on his social media handle.

The Bhootnii trailer: Sanjay Dutt takes on Palak Tiwari and Mouni Roy's ghostsThe first full trailer of Sanjay Dutt's upcoming horror-comedy, Bhootnii, is here. Apart from Dutt, the film also features Sunny Singh, Palak Tiwari and Mouni Roy in pivotal roles.

Shreyas Talpade denies involvement in multi-crore scam, releases statementActor Shreyas Talpade has released a statement after it was alleged that he was involved in a multi-crore chit fund scam. Talpade has denied the allegations.
Taarak Mehta creators finalise Dayaben, mock shoots underway: ReportTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah makers have finally found their Dayaben, which was originally played by Disha Vakani.

Hrithik Roshan, ex-wife Sussanne's birthday wish for son Hrehaan on 19th birthdayHrithik Roshan and Sussanne Khan extended their wishes to their elder son, Hrehaan, on his 19th birthday. The two shared adorable posts on social media.

Hollywood stars slam Academy's reaction to No Other Land director's attackHollywood stars such as Mark Ruffalo, Olivia Colman and Javier Bardem, among over 600 members of the Academy, have signed an open letter criticising its lack of response to Oscar-winning director Hamdan Ballal's attack by the Israeli military. The Academy has since apologised.

James Gunn's Superman has a cameo by a big Hollywood star: ReportFilmmaker James Gunn's Superman will feature a surprise cameo by a major Hollywood star. Earlier, it was being speculated that Hollywood superstar Tom Cruise would star in it.

Prithviraj directed to make changes to Empuraan after claims of hurting sentimentsL2: Empuraan producer Gokulam Gopalan has said that he has asked director-actor Prithviraj to make changes to the film after it was claimed that it hurt the sentiments of a certain section of the audience.

Not all nepos: Rising above the 'nepo kid' tag with talentThe debate around 'nepo kids' in Bollywood continues, with new generations facing sharper scrutiny. Actors like Babil Khan, Zahan Kapoor, and Aditya Rawal are quietly sidestepping the hype by focusing on content-driven cinema, proving their talent beyond their familial connections.
Priyanka Chopra's Citadel Season 2 postponed to 2026: ReportAll Citadel spinoff series have been put on hold until Season 2 premieres. The shooting for the second season wrapped in November 2024.

Salman Khan praises Rashmika, shares how she shot for Sikandar, Pushpa 2 togetherBollywood superstar Salman Khan heaped praise on his Sikandar co-star Rashmika Mandanna and said that the actor's dedication to her craft was inspiring.

Salman Khan reveals why he never prays for a film's successSalman Khan, in an exclusive interview, spoke about how he has never prayed for his films. The actor mentioned that his film's success lies in the hands of the audience.

Salman Khan reveals Salim Khan's reaction to his debut film Biwi Ho Toh AisiSalman Khan recalled how his father, veteran screenwriter Salim Khan, joined him for the Sikandar trailer launch. The actor even reminisced the time he showed his debut film, Biwi Ho Toh Aisi, to his father.

Dupahiya 2: Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane and cast announce new season with fun videoAfter Dupahiya captivated audiences with its sharp humour and outstanding performances, Prime Video renewed the show for a second season.

I don't even sit on set: Salman Khan shuts down work ethic rumoursSalman Khan, speaking exclusively with India Today, addressed misconceptions about his punctuality on film sets while discussing his professional discipline. During the interview, the actor reflected on his career in the film industry.

Empuraan box office Day 2: Mohanlal, Prithviraj Sukumaran's film earns Rs 33 croreDirected by Prithviraj Sukumaran, L2: Empuraan earned Rs 33 crore in two days. Starring Mohanlal in the lead, the action thriller released in theatres on March 27.

general news.headline: Over 1,600 killed in Myanmar earthquake, damaged roads, infra hinder rescue opsThe deaths from the powerful quake surpassed 1,600, according to a Myanmar military leader, with a US agency warning that the toll could exceed 10,000.

Day after woman's body found in bed box, Delhi flat owner arrested, husband on runThe police stated that both arrested accused are trying to mislead the investigation, adding that the motive for the murder will only become clear after the husband is caught.

Myanmar quake released power of '334 atomic bombs', expert warns of aftershocksMyanmar's deadly 7.7 earthquake unleashed the force of 334 atomic bombs, with experts warning of months-long aftershocks. A communication blackout and civil war obscure the true scale of the devastation.

PM in Nagpur today, to pay tribute to RSS founders, launch key infra projectsPM Modi will pay tribute to RSS founders KB Hedgewar and MS Golwalkar, will inaugurate multiple projects, and visit key sites in Nagpur today.

Visuals: Moon blocks sun as 2025 sees its first partial solar eclipseA partial solar eclipse was visible on Saturday across parts of the US, Canada, Europe, and Africa. The event created a crescent sun and a rare double sunrise. Enthusiasts gathered worldwide, while observatories streamed the phenomenon live.

Rohit must pretend he's playing IPL in India blue, not MI blue: VaughanMichael Vaughan joked that Rohit Sharma should imagine himself in an India jersey to find his form for Mumbai Indians. With two losses already, MI desperately need Rohit to fire as they face KKR at the Wankhede next.

Hamas agrees to release 5 hostages under new ceasefire deal, Israel countersIsrael said it had held a series of consultations according to the proposal that was received from the mediators, and that it had conveyed to the mediators a counter-proposal in full coordination with the United States.

NRI barged in, hit Saif Ali Khan: Actor testifies in 2012 hotel brawl caseBollywood actor Amrita Arora Ladak testified in a Mumbai court on Saturday in the 2012 assault case against Saif Ali Khan. Recalling the incident, she stated that while dining in a private enclosure, NRI businessman Iqbal Sharma barged in and began shouting at them.

Operation Brahma: India airlifts aid, deploys rescuers, medics to quake-hit MyanmarIndia, acting as the first responder, has announced immediate assistance for Myanmar following the deadly earthquake. Under Operation Brahma, over 55 tonnes of relief materials, along with two NDRF teams and a medical crew, have been dispatched to support post-earthquake operations.

Slowest ball in IPL history? MI pacer Satyanarayana Raju surprises Jos ButtlerIPL 2025, GT vs MI: Satyanarayana Raju bowled one of the slowest deliveries of the Indian Premier League in his first over against Gujarat Titans. The slower-ball bouncer took ages to reach Jos Butler, who smashed it to a boundary.

Exclusive: Salman Khan gets candid on work ethics rumours, Sikandar and moreIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Sikandar stars Salman Khan and Rashmika Mandanna spoke about their upcoming film, its making and more. Directed by AR Murugadoss, Sikandar releases on March 30.

MK Stalin on AIADMK leader's Delhi visit: Switched 4 cars before meeting Amit ShahTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin mocked AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswam for skipping the assembly to meet Amit Shah in Delhi, criticising his absence during the Waqf Amendment Bill resolution.

Honk if you hate Elon Musk: Protesters target Tesla showrooms across US, EuropeThe protesters are trying to escalate a movement targeting Tesla dealerships and vehicles in opposition to Musk's role as the head of the newly created Department of Government Efficiency, where he has gained access to sensitive data and shuttered entire agencies.

Chair of charity set up by Prince Harry accuses him of bullying, harassmentThe chair of Prince Harry's charity, Sentebale, accused him of "harassment and bullying at scale" after he resigned amid a "devastating" dispute.

IPL 2025, GT vs MI: Gujarat enjoy fine-tuned pitch, hammer Mumbai for first winIPL 2025, GT vs MI Match Report: Gujarat Titans came up with an improved all-round show, enjoying the sluggishness of the pitch at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Mumbai Indians' batting failed as they fell 36 runs short of the total to slip to their second successive defeat.

IAS officer Sujata Karthikeyan, wife of VK Pandian, takes voluntary retirementSujata R Karthikeyan, an Odisha cadre IAS officer and wife of VK Pandian, has been granted voluntary retirement effective March 13, 2025, with relaxation of the notice period.
Mumbai woman's appreciation post for IndiGo sparks discussion on inclusive air travelIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a specially abled woman from Mumbai shared her flying experience with IndiGo.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Sikandar review and release: Salman Khan's film gears up for a grand premiereSalman Khan is gearing up for a spectacular comeback to the big screen with 'Sikandar', an action-packed thriller directed by AR Murugadoss. Set for a theatrical release on March 30, the film promises adrenaline-pumping entertainment for audiences.

Uttar Pradesh bans meat sales within 500 metres of religious sites during NavratriNo slaughtering of animals or sale of meat will be allowed within 500 meters of religious places in Uttar Pradesh during the Navratri festivities, the state government said.

Tear gas from police drill leaves schoolgirls hospitalised in RanchiRanchi Police's mock drill turned hazardous as tear gas spread into a nearby school, causing severe breathing issues among students.

Iftar: The politics of breaking bread in BiharIn an election year, even an iftar dinner is a political feast, where every plate is served with calculation and every attendee potentially represents a vote bloc

US pauses some Green Card processing, Indians might be hitThe US has put on hold some Green Card processing amid rigorous vetting of permanent residency applications. The move is aimed at those who seek refuge in the US, claiming persecution in their home countries. Scores of Indians seeking to stay in the US make such claims.

IndiGo flight makes emergency landing in Lucknow after passenger's deathThe incident happened while victim Satish Chandra Burman (63), a resident of Assam's Nalbari, was travelling with his wife Kanchan and cousin-in-law Keshav Kumar on IndiGo flight 6E 2163 en route from Patna to Delhi.

sports.headline: Rohit must pretend he's playing IPL in India blue, not MI blue: VaughanMichael Vaughan joked that Rohit Sharma should imagine himself in an India jersey to find his form for Mumbai Indians. With two losses already, MI desperately need Rohit to fire as they face KKR at the Wankhede next.

Don't want all games to be 240-250: Gill on black soil pitch for GT vs MIShubman Gill defended the use of the black soil pitch in Ahmedabad during the Gujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians clash, claiming that they wanted to keep the game equal between bat and ball. GT secured their first win of the season on Saturday, March 29.

DC vs SRH predicted XI: Who will KL Rahul replace in Delhi lineup?Delhi Capitals and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all set to lock horns in an exciting contest in Vizag on Sunday, March 30. KL Rahul is expected to make his DC debut while the fitness of Mukesh Kumar will also be a cause for concern for the Capitals.

Sunrisers look to recover from LSG defeat against confident CapitalsIPL 2025, Delhi Capitals vs Sunrisers Hyderabad Match Preview: Having lost to Lucknow Super Giants in their previous game, Pat Cummins' SRH will be eager to bounce back against the Capitals in their first away match.

IPL 2025 Points Table, March 29: GT up on third after MI winMumbai Indians' batting collapse against Gujarat Titans extended their losing streak at Ahmedabad, and jumped to number 4 in the IPL 2025 points table. The match saw Sai Sudharshan jump up in the Orange cap race with Sai Kishore also catching up in the Purple cap battle.

MI unprofessional in field, batters need to take responsibility: Hardik PandyaMumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya blamed the team's poor fielding after their loss against Gujarat Titans. Mumbai lost their second game in a row in the IPL on Saturday, March 29.

Hardik Pandya and Sai Kishore in heated staring battle, umpire intervenesGujarat Titans vs Mumbai Indians saw some intense moments on the field on Saturday, March 29. GT's R Sai Kishore and MI captain Hardik Pandya engaged in a heated war of words during the match.

IPL 2025, GT vs MI: Gujarat enjoy fine-tuned pitch, hammer Mumbai for first winIPL 2025, GT vs MI Match Report: Gujarat Titans came up with an improved all-round show, enjoying the sluggishness of the pitch at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Mumbai Indians' batting failed as they fell 36 runs short of the total to slip to their second successive defeat.

Ashish Nehra screams at GT batters after late collapse. Video goes viralGujarat Titans coach Ashish Nehra was left infuriated in their match against Mumbai Indians on Saturday, March 29. Nehra screamed at his batters as the side lost 5 wickets in the last 13 balls of the game.

Mohammed Siraj dismisses Rohit Sharma with new ball, fans say revenge served hotIPL 2025, GT vs MI: Mohammed Siraj bowled a ripper of a delivery to dismiss Rohit Sharma in Ahmedabad on Saturday. Siraj shone with the new ball, picking two wickets in the powerplay for his new franchise, Gujarat Titans.

Slowest ball in IPL history? MI pacer Satyanarayana Raju surprises Jos ButtlerIPL 2025, GT vs MI: Satyanarayana Raju bowled one of the slowest deliveries of the Indian Premier League in his first over against Gujarat Titans. The slower-ball bouncer took ages to reach Jos Butler, who smashed it to a boundary.

Mumbai Indians' batting failed as they fell 36 runs short of the total to slip to their second successive defeat.

Siraj shone with the new ball, picking two wickets in the powerplay for his new franchise, Gujarat Titans.

MI pacer Satyanarayana Raju surprises Jos ButtlerIPL 2025, GT vs MI: Satyanarayana Raju bowled one of the slowest deliveries of the Indian Premier League in his first over against Gujarat Titans. The slower-ball bouncer took ages to reach Jos Butler, who smashed it to a boundary.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
